results.title: Earth, fire and water
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Peter Johnson and Fred Richardson
results.brief_description: Documentary examination of Australian natural disasters. People are interviewed about their experiences in floods, bushfires, cyclones etc. Emergency services personnel give advice about the best way to prevent and cope with disasters

results.title: Earth satellites: explorers of outer space
results.brief_description: Scenes at the Army and Navy launching site show satellites being built, prepared for launching and taking off. Uses animated drawings to explain why satellites stay in orbit, how orbits may vary, and how information is received from satellites. Includes a sequence describing things to come in the space age.

results.title: Earth is a battlefield
results.creator_credit: W.M. Larkins Studio, Geoffrey Sumner and Dick Taylor
results.brief_description: A light-hearted history of the contribution steel has made to world food supplies and the importance of exports made from steel in paying for imported food. Original animation techniques, with a good musical score and a commentary of rhyming couplets make for a delightful and useful film. Animation by Beryl Stevens and others

results.title: Earth = Zemlya
results.brief_description: The story is so slight as to be almost plotless; the young peasants of a Ukranian village want to buy a tractor to bring the future a little faster to their village but the kulaks of the community fear this strengthened unity and one of them kills the young village chairman. Yet this summary scarcely hints of all the qualities and passages that have made “Earth” one of the acknowledged classics of the Soviet and world cinema. The unique beauty of “Earth”, Dovzhenko’s best and last silent film, brought him international fame.

results.title: Earth = Zemlia (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: VUFKU, Black Hawk Films and Oleksandr Petrovych Dovzhenko
results.brief_description: This classic Soviet film tells the story of a farming community in Iaresky in the Ukraine and of a landowner who refuses to hand over his land for a collective farm. However more importantly is the rustic beauty of this film in its telling of life, love and death. Cast: Simon Svashenko (Basil), Stephen Shukurat (Basil’s father), Peter Masokna (Thomas Whitehorse), Ellen Maximova (Basil’s fiancee). Note: Original Russian film soundtrack suffered of poor quality so was replaced by music score and English subtitles (added by Black Hawk Films) and the Russian dialogue removed.

results.title: Earth
results.creator_credit: Cracking the Earth Films, Goldwyn films, Deepa Mehta and Annie Masson
results.brief_description: The second part of a trilogy whose theme is the elements (1996’s ‘Fire’ being the first film), Deepa Mehta’s ‘Earth’ examines the subject of India’s partition as a means to deal with land literally and figuratively. Based on an autobiography, the film mixes romance and social drama, often emotionally wrenching, with a potent finale. The story is told from the perspective of eight year old Lenny, a girl from an affluent Parsee family. The setting is Lahore in 1947, a city in which Hindu, Muslim, Sikh and Parsee coexist in harmony. However the prospect of independence is looming, with the notion of a separate Muslim country, Pakistan, presumably part of the bargain. Initially, the prospect of violent change appears distantly removed from the group of young adults who gravitate around Lenny’s Hindu nanny, Shanta. Almost overnight the mood changes and friends find themselves on opposing sides. Adapted from the book ‘Cracking India’ by Bapsi Sidhawa, the cast includes Aamir Khan, Nandita Das and Rahul Khanna. In English and Hindi with English subtitles.

results.title: Ears: their structure and care
results.brief_description: Illustrates the structure of the outer, middle and inner ear and describes the role of each in the hearing process. Discusses care of the ear and treatment of some common ailments relating to the ear. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Ears hear
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of ears. Provides a basic understanding of how sounds are transmitted and received. Describes the various structures of the ear and shows how they function. Promotes good ear care habits.

results.title: Earnings in conflict
results.brief_description: A proposal by Lord Wilfred Brown to combat the wages inflation in Great Britain. The narrative is set in the future, at a time when such a system has been adopted. An American TV interviewer is the linkman, making an enquiry into the “revolutionary” British procedure.

results.title: Early trick films [1898-1912]
results.brief_description: Compilation including “The House that Jack built” (dir. G.A. Smith); “Upside down or the human flies” (dir. R.W. Paul); “The Brahmin and the butterfly” (dir. Georges Melies); “The Motorist” (dir. R.W. Paul); “The Magic screen”; “Dante’s inferno”; and in its entirety, “The Invisible thief”.
